resourceTitle.en: 03 integrated column data using spectrophotometer Dobson measurements at the OMP
resourceTitle.fr: Données de colonnes intégrées d’O3 issues de mesures par le spectrophotomètre Dobson à l’OMP

resourceAbstract.en: The integrated column O3 data were obtained by spectrophotometer Dobson at the OMP (Observatoire Midi-Pyrénées) station belonging to NDACC (Network for Detection of Atmospheric Composition Change) network. It's a french activity from the Service d’Observation NDACC-France of CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique)/INSU (Institut National des Sciences de l’Univers) coordinated nationally by OVSQ (Observatoire de l’université de Versailles).
resourceAbstract.fr: Les colonnes intégrées d'O3 stratosphérique ont été mesurées par un Dobson à l'OMP (Observatoire Midi-Pyrénées), station du réseau NDACC (Network for Detection of Atmospheric Composition Change). C'est le Service d'Observation NDACC-France du CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique)/INSU (Institut National des Sciences de l’Univers) coordonné nationalement par l'OVSQ (Observatoire de l’université de Versailles) qui a la charge de cette activité.

spatialExtents.name: Observatoire Midi-Pyrénées
spatialExtents.description: L’Observatoire Midi Pyrénées is a Observatoire des Sciences de l’Univers (OSU) and a component of the University Toulouse III - Paul Sabatier (UPS). It brings together the universities, planet and environment laboratories of the UPS around the missions of research, observation, teaching, dissemination of scientific culture and international cooperation.

description.fr: Accès aux données NDACC mesurées à l'OMP

description.DEFAULT_VALUE_KEY: All NDACC data more than two years old are public data.

The earliest Dobson Spectrophotometer was built in the mid-1920s by G.M.B. Dobson for the purpose of investigating atmospheric circulation by measuring changes in atmospheric ozone. This ground-based instrument measures column ozone by the technique of differential absorption of ultraviolet (UV) light with the sun (or moon) as a light source.By comparing the UV light intensity at wavelengths that are strongly absorbed and weakly absorbed by ozone, the column ozone content of the atmosphere is currently determinated
